member.name: P:ValidateFastaFile.clsMemoryUsageLogger.LogFolderPath
member.summary: Output folder for the log file
member.remarks: If this is an empty string, the log file is created in the working directory

member.name: P:ValidateFastaFile.clsMemoryUsageLogger.MinimumLogIntervalMinutes
member.summary: The minimum interval between appending a new memory usage entry to the log

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsMemoryUsageLogger.#ctor(System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: Folder in which to write the memory log file(s); if this is an empty string, the log file is created in the working directory
member.remarks: Use WriteMemoryUsageLogEntry to append an entry to the log file. Alternatively use GetMemoryUsageSummary() to retrieve the memory usage as a string

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsMemoryUsageLogger.GetFreeMemoryMB
member.summary: Returns the amount of free memory on the current machine
member.returns: Free memory, in MB

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsMemoryUsageLogger.GetPoolNonpagedMemory
member.summary: Returns the amount of pool nonpaged memory on the current machine
member.returns: Pool Nonpaged memory, in MB

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsMemoryUsageLogger.GetPoolPagedMemory
member.summary: Returns the amount of pool paged memory on the current machine
member.returns: Pool Paged memory, in MB

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsMemoryUsageLogger.GetProcessMemoryUsageMB
member.summary: Returns the amount of memory that the currently running process is using
member.returns: Memory usage, in MB

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsMemoryUsageLogger.InitializePerfCounters
member.summary: Initializes the performance counters
member.returns: Any errors that occur; empty string if no errors

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsMemoryUsageLogger.WriteMemoryUsageLogEntry
member.summary: Writes a status file tracking memory usage

member.returns: Returns True if any command line parameters were found; otherwise false
member.remarks: If /? or /help is found, then returns False and sets mShowHelp to True

member.name: P:ValidateFastaFile.clsNestedStringDictionary`1.Count
member.summary: Number of items stored with Add()

member.name: P:ValidateFastaFile.clsNestedStringDictionary`1.IgnoreCase
member.summary: True when we are ignoring case for stored keys

member.name: P:ValidateFastaFile.clsNestedStringDictionary`1.SpannerCharLength
member.summary: The number of characters at the start of keystrings to use when adding items to clsNestedStringDictionary instances
member.remarks: If this value is too short, all of the items added to the clsNestedStringDictionary instance will be tracked by the same dictionary, which could result in a dictionary surpassing the 2 GB boundary

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsNestedStringDictionary`1.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Byte)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: True to create case-insensitve dictionaries (and thus ignore differences between uppercase and lowercase letters)
member.remarks: If spannerCharLength is too small, all of the items added to this class instance using Add() will be tracked by the same dictionary, which could result in a dictionary surpassing the 2 GB boundary

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsNestedStringDictionary`1.Add(System.String,`0)
member.summary: Store a key and its associated value
member.exception: Thrown if the key has already been stored

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsNestedStringDictionary`1.Clear
member.summary: Remove the stored items

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsNestedStringDictionary`1.ContainsKey(System.String)
member.summary: Check for the existence of a key
member.returns: True if the key exists, otherwise false

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsNestedStringDictionary`1.GetSizeSummary
member.summary: Return a string summarizing the number of items in the dictionary associated with each spanning key
member.returns: String description of the stored data
member.remarks: Example return strings: 1 spanning key: 'a' with 1 item 2 spanning keys: 'a' with 1 item and 'o' with 1 item 3 spanning keys: including 'a' with 1 item, 'o' with 1 item, and 'p' with 1 item 5 spanning keys: including 'a' with 2 items, 'p' with 2 items, and 'w' with 1 item

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsNestedStringDictionary`1.GetDictionaryForSpanningKey(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve the dictionary associated with the given spanner key
member.returns: The dictionary, or nothing if the key is not found

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsNestedStringDictionary`1.GetSpanningKeys
member.summary: Retrieve the list of spanning keys in use
member.returns: List of keys

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsNestedStringDictionary`1.TryGetValue(System.String,`0@)
member.summary: Try to get the value associated with the key
member.param: Value found, or nothing if no match
member.returns: True if a match was found, otherwise nothing

member.name: T:ValidateFastaFile.clsNestedStringDictionary`1
member.summary: This class implements of dictionary where keys are strings and values are type T (for example string or integer) Internally it uses a set of dictionaries to track the data, binning the data into separate dictionaries based on the first few letters of the keys of an added key/value pair

member.name: F:ValidateFastaFile.clsValidateFastaFile.mProteinNameSpannerCharLength
member.summary: The number of characters at the start of keystrings to use when adding items to clsNestedStringDictionary instances
member.remarks: If this value is too short, all of the items added to the clsNestedStringDictionary instance will be tracked by the same dictionary, which could result in a dictionary surpassing the 2 GB boundary

member.name: P:ValidateFastaFile.clsValidateFastaFile.OptionSwitch(ValidateFastaFile.IValidateFastaFile.SwitchOptions)
member.summary: Gets or sets a processing option
member.remarks: Be sure to call SetDefaultRules() after setting all of the options

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsValidateFastaFile.SetOptionSwitch(ValidateFastaFile.IValidateFastaFile.SwitchOptions,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set a processing option
member.remarks: Be sure to call SetDefaultRules() after setting all of the options

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsValidateFastaFile.AutoDetermineProteinNameSpannerCharLength(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Pre-scan a portion of the fasta file to determine the appropriate value for mProteinNameSpannerCharLength
member.param: Linefeed length (1 for LF or 2 for CRLF)
member.remarks: Reads 50 MB chunks from 10 sections of the Fasta file (or the entire Fasta file if under 500 MB in size) Keeps track of the portion of protein names in common between adjacent proteins Uses this information to determine an appropriate value for mProteinNameSpannerCharLength

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsValidateFastaFile.AutoDetermineProteinNameSpannerCharLength(System.IO.FileInfo,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Int32},System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Read a portion of the Fasta file, comparing adjacent protein names and keeping track of the name portions in common
member.returns: The number of lines read

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsValidateFastaFile.CorrectForDuplicateProteinSeqsInFasta(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Int32,ValidateFastaFile.clsProteinHashInfo[])
member.summary: Looks for duplicate proteins in the Fasta file Creates a new fasta file that has exact duplicates removed Will consolidate proteins with the same sequence if blnConsolidateDuplicateProteinSeqsInFasta=True

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsValidateFastaFile.GetBestSpaceIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Find the first space (or first tab) in the protein header line
member.remarks: Used for determining protein name

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsValidateFastaFile.SetDefaultRules
member.summary: Updates the validation rules using the current options
member.remarks: Call this function after setting new options using SetOptionSwitch

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsStackTraceFormatter.GetExceptionStackTrace(System.Exception)
member.summary: Parses the StackTrace text of the given exception to return a compact description of the current stack
member.returns: String of the form: "Stack trace: clsCodeTest.Test-:-clsCodeTest.TestException-:-clsCodeTest.InnerTestException in clsCodeTest.vb:line 86"
member.remarks: Useful for removing the full file paths included in the default stack trace

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsStackTraceFormatter.GetExceptionStackTraceMultiLine(System.Exception)
member.summary: Parses the StackTrace text of the given exception to return a cleaned up description of the current stack, with one line for each function in the call tree
member.returns: Stack trace: clsCodeTest.Test clsCodeTest.TestException clsCodeTest.InnerTestException in clsCodeTest.vb:line 86
member.remarks: Useful for removing the full file paths included in the default stack trace

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsStackTraceFormatter.GetExceptionStackTraceData(System.Exception)
member.summary: Parses the StackTrace text of the given exception to return a cleaned up description of the current stack
member.returns: List of function names; for example: clsCodeTest.Test clsCodeTest.TestException clsCodeTest.InnerTestException in clsCodeTest.vb:line 86

member.name: M:ValidateFastaFile.clsStackTraceFormatter.GetExceptionStackTraceData(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the given StackTrace text to return a cleaned up description of the current stack
member.returns: List of function names; for example: clsCodeTest.Test clsCodeTest.TestException clsCodeTest.InnerTestException in clsCodeTest.vb:line 86

member.name: T:ValidateFastaFile.clsStackTraceFormatter
member.summary: This class produces an easier-to read stack trace for an exception See the descriptions for functions GetExceptionStackTrace and GetExceptionStackTraceMultiLine for example text
